rules.text: Sexually explicit or violent media must be marked as sensitive when posting
No fascism, racism, sexism, ableism, homophobia, transphobia, xenophobia, casteism, or other bigotry
No incitement of violence or promotion of violent ideologies
No harassment or doxxing of other users
Do not share intentionally false or misleading information
You must be at least 13 years of age to register here
Please don't register on tilde.zone (this instance) for a media organisation, political organisation, government agency, or if you are seeking to establish a corporate brand presence.
When filling out this application, please give a short reason why you feel that this community is relevant to you. We will use translation tools if we need to.
tilde.zone is not intended for minors. At our discretion, and for the legal safety of our volunteer organization, accounts of minors in Florida and other oppressive US states will be removed
Actively using accounts on instances that we ban for violating our rules (ie., transphobia/fascism/etc.) is grounds for the termination of your tilde.zone account.

records.text: i would note on review that apparently "gell-mann amnesia" as a concept has been largely, perhaps entirely, co-opted by the kind of liar who seeks to convince his* audience that only he* is telling them the truth. the source and audience for such claims today both tend largely political tending to fascist-mystic, but that's irrelevant; anyone making such a claim on any basis merits only contempt regardless of the context, just like every other would-be cult leader, and anyone who buys in is pitiable at beston reviewing the origin of the term https://web.archive.org/web/20070714204136/http://www.michaelcrichton.net/speech-whyspeculate.html i find it's incompletely worked out even there, in that its author appears to possess or at least describe no real theory of mind for even professional journalists, which is especially remarkable for this having been a much more present distinction two decades agothere is a point of value to be made here with respect to both epistemology and metaepistemology, but crichton did such a shit job trying to make it that i think i'm just going to excise his resulting ill-considered and ill-formed concept from my lexicon entirely, and talk about epistemology when i mean epistemology, at least until some better shorthand comes along* invariably

records.text: i would note on review that apparently "gell-mann amnesia" as a concept has been largely, perhaps entirely, co-opted by the kind of liar who seeks to convince his* audience that only he* is telling them the truth. the source and audience for such claims today both tend largely political tending to fascist-mystic, but that's irrelevant; anyone making such a claim on any basis merits only contempt regardless of the context, just like every other would-be cult leader, and anyone who buys in is pitiable at beston reviewing the origin of the term https://web.archive.org/web/20070714204136/http://www.michaelcrichton.net/speech-whyspeculate.html i find it's incompletely worked out even there, in that its author appears to possess or at least describe no real theory of mind for even professional journalists, which is especially remarkable for this having been a much more present distinction two decades agothere is a point of value to be made here with respect to both epistemology and metaepistemology, but crichton did such a shit job trying to make it that i think i'm just going to excise his resulting ill-considered and ill-formed concept from my lexicon entirely, and talk about epistemology when i mean epistemology, at least until some better shorthand comes along* invariably

records.text: was listening to the 2002-2012 Flight Facilities Decade Mix earlier and triggered a bunch of memories of being an undergrad, not least:using GTD/Bullet Journaling/etc.when lifehacker was super cool and Gina Trapani was still running ithow computers were going to really solve a lot of problems: wikipedia, facebook, google chat/xmpp, etc. etc.My friend Gideon Addington (RIP) who I used to discuss Erich Fromm with all the time on the quadMy friend Tamara T. who is now an Episcopal priest and works in a group supporting people getting out of prisonProf. Tom Boyd, who passed away back in Februarythe banking crisis of 2008 and getting interested in macroecon for the first time
